greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Legendre symbol (n,7).
comment: This represents a non-principal Dirichlet character modulo 7.
reference: T. M. Apostol, Introduction to Analytic Number Theory, Springer-Verlag, 1986, page 139, k=7, Chi_2(n).
link: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (-1,-1,-1,-1,-1,-1).
maple: A := proc(n) numtheory[jacobi](n,7) ; end proc: seq(A(n),n=0..120) ;
xref: The Legendre symbols (n,p): A091337 (p = 2, Kronecker symbol), A102283 (p = 3), A080891 (p = 5), this sequence (p = 7), A011582 (p = 11), A011583 (p = 13), ..., A011631 (p = 251), A165573 (p = 257), A165574 (p = 263). Also, many other sequences for p > 263 are in the OEIS.
results.author: _R. J. Mathar_, Jul 29 2010
